title: ISic002932. funerary inscription for Rouphina
body:
1Ῥουφῖνα χαροῦσα ἐν
2Χ(ριστ)ῷ ἔτη ξε´ ἀνεπαύ-
3σατο πρὸ ιδ´ καλανδῶν ἰανουαρίων
4ἐπ(ὶ) (scil. τῇ) ια´ (scil. ὥρᾳ)

l.1 reg., orig. χαροῦσα

1ΡΟΥΦΙΝΑΧΑΡΟΥΣΑΕΝ
2ΧΩΕΤΗΞΕΑΝΕΠΑΥ
3ΣΑΤΟΠΡΟΙΔΚΑΛΑΝΔΩΝΙΑΝΟΥΑΡΙΩΝ
4ΕΠ(scil. ΤΗ)ΙΑ(scil. ΩΡΑ)

l.1 reg., orig. χαροῦσα

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text of Ferrua 1946-47 ;
  • line.4: Ferrua 1982-83: no.44 alternatively: ἐπ(ὶ τῇ) ια (ὑπατίᾳ); Feissel 1987: ἐπι(νεμήσεως) αʹ or ἐπι(νεμήσεως) ιαʹ

English translation

Jonathan Prag

Rouphina, rejoicing in Christ, died at 65 years of age, 14 days before the Kalends of January (19 December), at the 11th hour [or: in the 11th consulship (of Honorius); or in the 1st/11th indiction]

commentary

The reverse of the stone was re-used for a later Latin inscription (ISic001669).

bibliography

    Ferrua 1982-1983 15 no.44 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001996 Manganaro 1993 587 n.130 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001827
